concept.title: Apply scale factors
concept.shortdesc: You can set the following factor to determine whether the drawing is plotted on the model space or paper space.

ul.li: Text. Sets text height in the text style (STYLE) or in the process of creating text. The text plotted

conbody.p: height should be set in proportion to scale factor in model space. The text created on the layout should be set at 1:1.

ul.li: Dimension. Sets dimension scale in the dimension style (DIMSTYLE) or through system variable DIMSCALE.

Linetype. To plot objects from the Model tap, use system variables CELTSCALE and LTSCALE to set the scale for non-continuous lines. To plot objects froma layout (paper space), use systemvariable PSLTCALE.
Hatch. Sets hatch scale in the Hatch and Gradient dialog box or through system variable HPSCALE.
View. When you plot a drawing from a layout, you may need to use ZOOM XP command, where XP is a ratio that is relative to the paper size (scale factor of reciprocal).
